column1: It would prevent permanent damage to our economy by helping small businesses and those they employ make it through the coronavirus.
If re-elected we will get Americans safely back to work and our economy back to pre-Covid levels.  American simply cannot afford four years of a California style federal government.
I’m wishing @realDonaldTrump and First Lady Melania Trump a speedy recovery. I’ll continue to keep all those affected by the coronavirus in my prayers.

According to the NYT: “When the coronavirus emerged in China in January the World Health Organization didn’t flinch in its advice: Do not restrict travel. But what is now clear is that the policy was about politics and economics more than public health”.

@JoeBiden is openly campaigning on eliminating the Tax Cuts & Jobs act and levying $3T in new raising taxes. This would stunt our economic recovery coming out of Covid and force American jobs overseas.   https://t.co/K64r8MoMi6
The WHO needs to be held accountable for their relationship with the Chinese Communist Party that led to a failure to tackle the coronavirus at its onset.  https://t.co/LPOLIpjFBh
Over 60% of the small business who have shut their doors due to Covid will stay permanently closed. My RESTART Act will keep these small businesses and their workers intact.  https://t.co/ODULUCzLRi

In order to save our hardest hit small businesses from permanent closure we need to pass my RESTART Act. It would build upon the Paycheck Protection Program allowing more flexibility and give small businesses a path back to growth coming out of Covid.  https://t.co/mGHIRONAKB
Congress should be coming together to give targeted relief to the hardest hit Americans instead of using the coronavirus as a means to insert unrelated political priorities into a relief package.

Small businesses are the heart of our economy but COVID-19 has pushed hundreds of thousands to the brink of failure. Half of America’s workforce works for a small business and as many as a quarter of small businesses are at risk of failure.
And have not budged from their $3T HEROES Act which is comprised of $2T in spending unrelated to the coronavirus.

Right now many of these workers and venues are going with little to no income through no fault of their own. My RESTART Act will support these Hoosier jobs so that when we get through Covid we can continue to be a national sporting and convention mecca.

These financial struggles are coming because 1-in-5 employers reported sales at 50% or lower than before the start of COVID-19 pandemic. 1-in-5 of the small businesses who were surveyed said they will be out of business if economic conditions don’t improve in the next 6 months.

Over 100000 small business have permanently closed their doors due to Covid. There will be “No Way Back” for countless more if Congress does not pass my Restart Act. #RedAlertRESTART 🚨 https://t.co/EXXXJIQ22b

To “Roll with the Changes” brought about by Covid we need to pass my RESTART Act. It will prevent the permanent closure of our small businesses and ensure that Americans have jobs to return to when we make it through this. https://t.co/W8zsrtiUTw

Covid has only exacerbated the need for rural broadband. In the Senate I'm fighting to secure more funding so that our Hoosier students and rural communities aren’t left behind in this 21st century economy.  https://t.co/HNgK6n8UnZ
I visited Tyler Truss System in Pendleton to see firsthand how it would help this small business and others like it. They have seen a 96% decline in revenue since Covid began.

Tyler Truss Systems in Pendleton has seen a 96% drop in business since the start of Covid. My RESTART Act will help this small business and others like it make through the pandemic while keeping their workers on the payroll.   https://t.co/bmr85YHlCm

I’m proud to be joined by @realDonaldTrump in holding the WHO accountable for their mismanagement of the coronavirus outbreak and for their failure to cooperate with the rest of the world at the onset of the virus. https://t.co/i6wIURDdZ0

Enjoyed visiting The Barns at Nappanee with Christy and Marlin Stutzman to hear how my RESTART Act would help this hardest hit Hoosier small business and others like it make it through Coronavirus.   https://t.co/q05R591cax

About 25% of the restaurants they supplied pre Covid have not reopened. My RESTART Act will give targeted relief to these hardest hit Hoosier small businesses so they may remain intact and keep their employees working.

Instead of giving tax breaks that are unrelated to Coronavirus relief to millionaires Congress should come together to bolster our families workers small businesses schools and front line healthcare heroes in a targeted way so that long term damage and job loss does not occur

My RESTART Act will give targeted help to the hardest hit small business as they work to grapple with the effects of the coronavirus particularly those who have been forced to shutter or reduce their capacity of their business through no fault of their own.

The only party to blame for the Coronavirus is the Chinese Communist Party. We should be unified as a country on this.   China should have sounded the alarm from the start of the outbreak and worked with the world to contain the virus. https://t.co/givXNva21S
Coronavirus relief: Bipartisan duo tries to create opening for broader small business program. https://t.co/7ZUSJYHIqm

Years of thoughtful Hoosier conservative leadership and the building up of a rainy day fund leaves Indiana in a strong position to weather the fiscal fallout from the coronavirus. https://t.co/sQwEg96QHy

I recently visited Kenny's Gun Sales  in New Albany to witness how Hoosier small businesses are adapting to the coronavirus. As your Senator I will continue to stand strong for the 2nd Amendment in Washington DC. https://t.co/ISXLFMRxil
My RESTART Act creates a path for job creators to grown and expand coming out of this coronavirus crisis.

Following news that showed Planned Parenthood applying for and receiving a total of $80 million in PPP loans I’m calling on the DOJ to investigate Planned Parenthood for improperly claiming coronavirus-relief loans designed for small businesses. https://t.co/sj7lomGnNL

The Coronavirus crisis should not be used to advance a socialist wish list.  Congress has already spent nearly $3 trillion to fight the coronavirus and stabilize our economy.  We need to take the “wait and see approach” when it comes to additional stimulus spending.

Speaker Pelosi’s proposed $3 trillion 1800 page stimulus bill is “dead on arrival” in the Senate.   Democrats call for long sought after progressive pet projects that have nothing to do with addressing the coronavirus such as:

I’ve spoken to over 22000 Hoosiers directly over the past number of weeks and I am continually impressed by the countless acts of courage and compassion being shown by Hoosiers in the fight against the coronavirus. https://t.co/9ZJeBvIcr5

I introduced the Covid-19 Accountability Act alongside @LindseyGrahamSC. This would authorize President Trump to impose sanctions on China if they do not cooperate with International investigations on the events leading up to the outbreak of the coronavirus. https://t.co/7DDqnmCFxW

We need transparency from the Chinese government we need transparency from the World Health Organization. So far we have received neither. Transparency from all fronts is needed to come up with vaccines and treatments for COVID-19 as quickly as possible. https://t.co/TPgV9Sj9lw

Senate and House Democrats want to pass additional multi trillion dollar coronavirus relief bills that would give targeted bailouts to liberal states and cities for debt acquired prior to the coronavirus. My No Government Bailout Act would prevent this. https://t.co/Ur6nsfJDMC

The Blue Angels will fly over Indianapolis at 2 p.m. tomorrow to salute health care workers first responders and other essential personnel who have been serving on the front lines during the COVID-19 pandemic.https://t.co/MnOaRsdEm0

The Chinese Communist Party needs to be held accountable for their behavior that has led to a coronavirus pandemic. We would not be in the situation we are in right now but for their misbehavior. https://t.co/2YvbiYhYJw

Chuck Schumer and Nancy Pelosi are attempting to use the coronavirus crisis to pass a $1 trillion bailout of reckless spending states and cities. States like Indiana should not be punished for our fiscal responsibility. Congress needs to pass my Government Bailout Prevention Act. https://t.co/4IapPtF29T

Proud to have played a role in cutting red tape to enable Hoosier manufacturers and distillers to rapidly produce hand sanitizer. This story from Kem Krest in Elkhart County is an excellent example of Hoosier innovation & spirit on display in combating Covid-19. https://t.co/jqGogXJExP

In light of the actions taken by the Communist Party of China to hoard global medical supplies and conceal from the world the severity of the coronavirus I have introduced The Furthering Our Recovery With American Research and Development Act with @jackiewalorski

Bloomington based Catalent will be scaling up operations and hiring over 300 additional Hoosiers to combat the coronavirus pandemic by manufacturing the Covid-19 vaccine when discovered. #HoosiersHelpingHoosiers https://t.co/2rXekQjlgE

I recently spoke with the IU College Republicans. They updated me on the challenges Hoosier students are overcoming in light of the coronavirus. Charlie asked me a great question about China’s role in this that’s on the minds of so many Hoosiers I speak to. @RepublicansIU https://t.co/iM2QmGYio7

Speaker Nancy Pelosi seeks a $1 trillion bailout of highly indebted states and cities. I introduced the Government Bailout Protection Act.  This would prevent high debt states like Illinois from receiving federal funds to bail themselves out for debt accrued prior to Covid-19

Hoosiers in the Fort Wayne area - be sure tomorrow to view the 122nd Fighter Wing’s fly over of the city’s hospitals to salute the health care workers fighting the coronavirus. https://t.co/wnR3CDDuix

Nancy Pelosi is calling for a federal bailout of out of out-of-control spending states like Illinois California and New York. Hardworking Hoosiers and states like Indiana who function within their means should not have to pay for the debt that they acquired prior to Covid https://t.co/mGpp0MZsdh

Another fantastic example of Hoosier innovation on display in the partnership between Deaconess Hospital and Berry Plastics in Evansville. Special  face shields are being produced to protect newborn Hoosiers in the midst of coronavirus. https://t.co/aZj20MBvby

I’m grateful that @realDonaldTrump has asked me to join his Coronavirus Economic Task Force and I look forward to working with him and my colleagues in Congress to safely get our country back to work.  https://t.co/MFn64rUcPL

Hoosiers are fortunate to be led by the exceptional leadership of @HolcombForIN and his team.  I encourage all Hoosiers to tune in to the Governor’s daily 2:30 PM update on the coronavirus. Here is the link from today: https://t.co/eJ91Mt2WYL

Young touted the federal CARES Act the coronavirus emergency relief package. "Our emphasis on the federal level is keeping our households whole " he said. Young said stimulus payments should be hitting bank accounts for those with information on file this week. https://t.co/cDkECFyMKs
In response to the coronavirus Indiana Signworks located in Fort Wayne is manufacturing sneeze guards to keep retail workers safe.  #HoosiersHelpingHoosiers https://t.co/vcEubT55eu

Hospitals across Indiana will be getting a portion of 185000 N95 respirators 440000 surgical masks 87000 face shields 71000 gowns and 348000 gloves. It’s to help hospitals and medical workers stay protected as they treat people with coronavirus.  https://t.co/VFE3iRto7A

Evansville’s Anchor Industries a small business founded in 1892 is shipping emergency relief tents across the country to provide medical professionals more locations to combat COVID-19. https://t.co/iRLZ9aniD8
Sterno Products in Laporte is now making over 3000 masks a day to combat the coronavirus. https://t.co/kpL80EHdSF via @nwi

Fortville-based Genesis Plastics Welding says it is increasing the production of hyperbaric oxygen hoods to aid the fight against COVID-19. It’s efforts will free up ventilators for the most critically ill coronavirus patients. #HoosiersHelpingHoosiers  https://t.co/whaoNes7EY
Indiana is receiving high speed coronavirus testing machines from Abbott Labs capable of testing Hoosiers in less than 15 minutes.  https://t.co/rkLQyIVL5t

Indiana medical device companies continue to contribute in substantial ways in the fight against Coronavirus. Warsaw’s @Medtronic is now manufacturing face shields for our front line healthcare professionals. #HoosiersHelpingHoosiers   https://t.co/DHIeWfmclh
Thank you to all of our Hoosier Doctors and healthcare professionals who are working around the clock to confront the Coronavirus!#DoctorsDay https://t.co/3VQTGH6GET

With the Cares Act now signed into law critical resources are being rushed to our nation in her time of need. Hoosiers appreciate the leadership of @POTUS @VP Dr. Fauci Dr. Birx @SecAzar @SeemaCMS and others during this Coronavirus crisis.

Late last night we passed legislation to provide relief to all families workers small businesses hospitals healthcare workers students and state & local governments dealing with the effects of the Coronavirus. https://t.co/G9EbdNIJVI
